info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 12:19PM CDT until June 12 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
FFWCRP
The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Goliad County in south central Texas... Victoria County in south central Texas... Northwestern Calhoun County in south Texas...
* Until 230 PM CDT.
* At 1219 PM CDT, Reports of flash flooding have been observed over the last few hours in the Victoria area, and between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area as additional storms move in from the west. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Victoria, Goliad, McFaddin, Guadalupe, Fannin, Point Comfort, Saxet Lakes, Downtown Victoria, Victoria Riverside Park, Victoria College, Victoria Detar Hospital North, Ball Airport Area, Victoria Colony Creek Country Club, Victoria Mall, Oak Village, Brentwood Subdivision, Victoria Regional Airport, Nursery, Telferner and Coleto Creek Park.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun, TX; Goliad, TX; Victoria, TX
